entry.title: Ritu Agarwal "VoiceOfRitu" at YouTube FanFest
entry.summary: YouTube Fanfest is the biggest Live event that happens around the world. Every year, the top creators of the country…
entry.content:
YouTube Fanfest is the biggest Live event that happens around the world. Every year, the top creators of the country get to interact with their fans and perform on this massive stage. The performances are streamed live to millions of people on YouTube. Like I said, it happens every year. But this year, it was special. Because my sisterÂ VoiceOfRituÂ was going to perform in it.

And as with any creative project, the thing about a stage is, for ever 1 minute of performance, you need at least 100 hours of preparation, planning & practice. And Iâ€™m not even exaggerating on the numbers. We had a 6 minute time on stage and we tried to give it our everything. In the process, I documented our journey throughout the preparation process.

Things started with the rehearsal at the JLN stadium, New Delhi which was about the first day of YouTube Fanfesst, New Delhi

This photo sums up almost everything. The background visual which started as a dream almost 1.5 years ago where we shot a video on our terrace and it suddenly broke the internet, Divyaraj being the confident drummer for our performance, Ritu gearing up for the show night, the stage team as usual having little or no clue what to do and me, always running around trying to hold everything together ðŸ˜„

With Prakhar as the additional instructor, we rehearsed everything from the mic positions to correct vocal angles just to make the best show possible!

And as the day ended, it was time for the actual showcase day! It started with a little meet-and-greet with fans and who else can be your biggest fans than your parents?

SHOWTIME!

Delhi was done and dusted and Mumbai awaited us with a lot more people and a HUGE stage.

Working behind the scenes all the time, Sushant & Khushi from Qyuki

And we did meet all the YouTube stars backstageÂ 

ðŸ˜„

And it was SHOWTIME again. But this time, with over 10 thousand people on the ground! Mumbai was huge!

And that was one hell of a night! And hereâ€™s the live stream of the performance:

entry.title: FaceTime Photo Shoots
entry.summary: While we are in the midst of the unfortunate Covid-19 outbreak, creativity has found its new ways. Introducing, FaceTime photo-shoots…
entry.content:
While we are in the midst of the unfortunate Covid-19 outbreak, creativity has found its new ways.

Introducing, FaceTime photo-shoots where you can be anywhere in the world & we will work with you to create amazing photographs right from the comfort of your home!

Can anything be simpler than this?

PS: All these photos were shot on Facetime, 100% remotely!

entry.title: Gaurav & Shilpi â€“ A Dehradun Lifestyle Shoot
entry.summary: Lifestyle and couple shoots are my all time favourites for one, they give me full creative freedom as a photographer…
entry.content:
Lifestyle and couple shoots are my all time favourites for one, they give me full creative freedom as a photographer and two, there are no super-tensed environments like a wedding. And no wonder, the â€œstoryâ€ part is the one that makes me work really hard for every single project.

When Shilpi emailed me to enquire about the possibility of documenting their love, I was super excited to know that they hail from Dehradun and Iâ€™d be shooting them there. So we decided on the dates and I packed my gear for the trip.

It was a 2-day schedule and I expected that everything was going to be smooth as butter. But as they say, â€œYou canâ€™t trust two things of Dehradun. The girls & the weatherâ€. Now Iâ€™m not sure about the former, the latter did play games with us. The moment I landed in Dehradun (which was a night before), it started raining. And it rained all night and during the next day as well.

But like I always say, if we have planned something, we will do that no matter what. So I reached Shilpiâ€™s home the next morning, half drenched. The conditions were not looking very positive but Shilpi & I were already finding ways to make it work. Gaurav however was convinced that the shoot wouldnâ€™t happen and ultimately, we had to team up against him and pull him out of the house ðŸ˜œ

It was still raining and I was determined to make it an advantage for us. Why not let the rain add to the emotional quotient of the whole shoot? Keeping that thought and risking my camera, lenses and nose (which was red by the end of the shoot anyway), we together made these photographs ðŸ˜‡

The rain stopped (or rather paused) after sometime but it was still drizzling. That was the time to, as Shilpi & I put it, to bring up the â€œBhawna (emotion) meterâ€ with Gaurav. Tough task, that was ðŸ¤£

Next morning, was a total flip in weather. It was bright, hot sunny all over and we were headed to Gaurav & Shilpiâ€™s place for that dayâ€™s shoot. Before going with our plan, we decided to get some moments in their backyard garden

After that, our original plan was to head to Mussorie as there was snow-fall on the hill-tops the previous day. However, because of that, everyone was headed the same way and the whole route was jammed. So we decided to cancel that plan and settle for something nearby.

Did I tell you, this is that couple which looks better when fighting? Yes ðŸ˜„

And that was Gaurav & Shilpi. That was Dehradun and that was a super tiring but amazing trip. Everything from the weather to the traffic conditions were against us but we turned everything to our advantage. I hope you felt the love from the photographs ðŸ˜„

Contact Us

entry.title: Love, Literally - Saumya & Arpan
entry.summary: Saumya & Arpan both work in Cambridge and Oxford respectively. Some office co-incidences made them somehow fall in love and…
entry.content:
Saumya & Arpan both work in Cambridge and Oxford respectively. Some office co-incidences made them somehow fall in love and I was called to put their love in photos. And then began the hunt for the perfect location. What could have been better than a library itself? With so many of our plans gone haywire, we finally managed to convince one librarian to let us shoot inside. And this is what followed

While Saumya was getting all excited on finding books and topics of her favourite writers, Arpan was discovering about their existenceÂ 

Bright sunlight and wind. It was perfect time for a Sunsilk ad photo ðŸ˜œ

And lastly, I played with some sunlight
